</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong></span><span>Just by looking at what happened in the stock market yesterday, you wouldn’t know the jobs report was close to a total disaster. The Dow and S&P hit </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/06/stock-futures-open-slightly-higher-ahead-of-key-april-jobs-report.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all-time highs</a></span><span>, while everyone’s watching </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-07/elon-musk-on-snl-live-has-dogecoin-doge-traders-planning-parties?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dogecoin</a></span><span> ahead of Elon Musk’s </span><span><em>SNL </em></span><span>appearance tonight (yes, a real sentence). <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/april-jobs-report-big-whiff-us-economy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Jobs Report Whiff
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Swing and a miss gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=399 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l2R04CaebgtebcxvG/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Swing and a miss gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l2R04CaebgtebcxvG/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday’s April jobs report was more disappointing than a Starburst pack filled only with yellow. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whereas economists had forecasted upwards of 1 million jobs added in April...the Labor Department said the US created <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-job-growth-far-below-expectations-april-amid-labor-shortages-2021-05-07/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just 266,000</a>. And the unemployment rate, which had been steadily dropping since last May, ticked up from 6% to 6.1%. Those numbers shocked pretty much everyone, given all the recent signs of a rapidly improving economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Digging <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/07/upshot/jobs-report-surprise.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">into the numbers</a>...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Temporary-help employment lost 111,000 jobs, manufacturing 18,000, and retail 15,000. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Travel and leisure continued to fuel the gains after getting TKO’d early in the pandemic, adding 331,000 jobs in April. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The economy is still down more than 8 million jobs from pre-pandemic levels and <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/07/april-2021-jobs-report-1-in-4-unemployed-have-been-out-of-work-for-a-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">29% of unemployed Americans</a> have now been out of work for at least a year.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happened?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not so clear. What we do know is that there is no shortage of job openings in certain industries like retail, manufacturing, and construction. So the question economists are sorting out right now is why more people aren’t going to work. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-07/softer-u-s-april-job-growth-indicates-challenges-to-recovery?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">few hypotheses</a>...<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Covid reasons: </strong></span><span>Despite a blazing vaccination rollout in the US, many people might still fear getting infected with the virus at work. Plus, with some schools still opting for remote learning, parents might be taking care of their kids instead of job hunting.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Skills mismatch: </strong></span><span>Perhaps the people looking for jobs don’t have the experience necessary to fill the types of jobs that are open.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Enhanced unemployment benefits: </strong></span><span>This, of course, is the most controversial hypothesis. Biden’s aid package extended extra unemployment benefits through the summer, and Republicans and many business owners have blamed the extra money for disincentivizing work. After the jobs report was released, the US Chamber of Commerce asked lawmakers to </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/us-chamber-calls-end-300-a-week-jobless-aid-ease-labor-shortage-2021-05-07/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">end the extra benefits</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>economists hope this jobs report was just a bizarre one-off, like Michael Jordan playing baseball. But President Biden said the labor market struggle bus is evidence that the US economy needs his twin infrastructure bills to return to full strength. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/vaccine-tracker-may-8?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vaccine Tracker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/vaccine-tracker-may-8" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Vaccine tracker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MzcxL3ZhY2NpbmVfdHJhY2tlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the US…</strong>the rate of vaccinations continues to decline. The US is averaging 2.09 million doses a day, a <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/health/covid-vaccine-states-distribution-doses/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">21% decrease</a> from the week before. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Around the world...</strong>enough doses have been administered to fully vaccinate 8.1% of the global population, but wealthier countries are vaccinating their citizens at a rate <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">25x faster</a> than lower income countries. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The latest headlines</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Getting the green light: </strong>The WHO <a href="https://www.axios.com/who-china-sinopharm-vaccine-9d855f79-85be-40bb-8573-a23cf942b8d5.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">authorized</a> China’s Sinopharm vaccine for emergency use, the sixth vaccine to have gotten a stamp of approval from the organization. Pfizer-BioNTech became the first vaccine maker to apply for full FDA approval on top of emergency use. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Vaccine incentives: </strong>States are pulling out their <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-07/new-jersey-governor-considering-cash-as-a-vaccine-incentive?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bag of tricks</a> to spur more demand for vaccinations. West Virginia is offering young adults a $100 savings bond in exchange for a shot, Maryland will give state workers $100, and NJ, which is already running a “shot and a beer” program, is considering handing out cash.    </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Further reading: </strong>How to vaccinate the world <a href="https://lpeproject.org/blog/how-to-vaccinate-the-world-part-1/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Part 1</a> and <a href="https://lpeproject.org/blog/how-to-vaccinate-the-world-part-2/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Part 2</a>. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/odds-rocket-fragments-falling-weekend-lowbut-not-zero?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Odds of Rocket Fragments Falling on You Are Low...But Not Zero
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/odds-rocket-fragments-falling-weekend-lowbut-not-zero" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Launch of Chinese rocket" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDIxL2xhdW5jaF9vZl9jaGluZXNlX3JvY2tldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Xinhua/Guo Cheng via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Debris from the Chinese rocket Long March-5B are expected to <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/china-rocket-space-falling/2021/05/07/e28412c4-af11-11eb-82c1-896aca955bb9_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fall back to Earth</a> this weekend, just over a week after it was launched into space. The craft’s husk is almost 100 feet long, and will be one of the largest objects to ever come back into the planet’s atmosphere on an uncontrolled reentry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This type of reentry is like ordering a swimsuit you saw on TikTok: There’s no way of knowing what you’re going to get. Scientists say there’s a 32-hour window over the weekend when it could hit, but aren’t sure where. There’s only a small chance of it hurting a person, but with some close calls like a <a href="https://www.space.com/spacex-rocket-debris-found-washington-farm?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=Debris%20from%20SpaceX%20rocket%20launch%20falls%20on%20farm%20in%20central%20Washington,-By%20Hanneke%20Weitering&text=A%20piece%20of%20debris%20from,stars%22%20the%20U.S.%20Pacific%20Northwest." target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">huge piece</a> of SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket ending up on a Washington farm in April, experts are calling the actions of China’s space program irresponsible.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> With lax international laws around space debris, countries can do things like send rockets into space and cause a minor freak out. Jonathan McDowell of the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics told the WaPo, “What there isn’t at the moment is what I call a ‘reckless driving law.’ You only get to complain if it actually crashes.”</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY AMAZON
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt="Amazon" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMzAwNi8xNjE5NzM1MDM1LU5ld3NsZXR0ZXJfUGxhY2VtZW50XzIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While you know Amazon as the company who sells _____ (insert pretty much anything here), their employees know them as a company who offers both comprehensive benefits and upward career trajectories.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For starters, <a href="https://www.aboutamazon.com/impact/economy/15-minimum-wage?utm_source=pd&utm_medium=di&utm_campaign=gj21&utm_term=mb&utm_content=news_mb_di_fhr_050821_1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Amazon offers its employees a starting pay of at least $15 per hour</a>—that’s more than double the federal minimum wage—as well as <strong style="color:#000">comprehensive benefits like health insurance, paid leave, and ways to save for the future</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Amazon doesn’t just stop at “for starters.” They also provide technical upskilling training programs to those interested in honing their technical know-how in the workplace—at Amazon or wherever their careers take them next.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, Amazon is dedicating more than $700 million to provide 100,000 employees with access to training programs by 2025. That’s a lotta new skillz that the world needs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.aboutamazon.com/impact/economy/15-minimum-wage?utm_source=pd&utm_medium=di&utm_campaign=gj21&utm_term=mb&utm_content=news_mb_di_fhr_050821_1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read more about all the benefits Amazon believes in, right here.</a></p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/key-performance-indicators-may-8?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Key Performance Indicators

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>About 45% of store openings announced so far this year by large retail chains are dollar stores, CNN Business <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/06/business/dollar-store-openings-retail/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>. Dollar General accounts for almost a third by itself.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“My friends are leaving California.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Caitlyn Jenner, <a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/y3dd5j/caitlyn-jenners-private-jet-owning-friends-are-leaving-california-because-they-have-to-see-poor-people?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">speaking to Fox News</a>, has a point: In 2020, California’s population <a href="https://www.politico.com/states/california/story/2021/05/07/california-population-drops-for-first-time-in-state-history-1380893?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declined</a> for the first time in the state’s recorded history. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>How much energy does bitcoin actually consume? <tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/elon-musk-hosts-snl-even-though-whole-life-feels-like-episode-snl?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We’ve Got Some Sketch Pitches
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/elon-musk-hosts-snl-even-though-whole-life-feels-like-episode-snl" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Musk on SNL" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDIwL211c2tfb25fc25sLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SNL/NBC</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Elon Musk hosts <em>SNL</em> tonight, and last weekend he took to Twitter to <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1388611645560262660?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crowdsource</a> some sketch ideas for the show. And while “Irony Man” is...a fine suggestion, we think some of the best ways to showcase the Technoking’s subtle, grounded performance style would be to just rewrite some of the moments in Musk’s life that have felt like <em>SNL</em> sketches:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">When he sold flamethrowers.</strong> In a promotional stunt to sell more hats, Musk’s tunnel construction company, The Boring Company, introduced “Not-A-Flamethrower” (the product’s official name) and it sold out in five days. In the <em>SNL</em> version, Bill Hader’s Stefon would be on “Weekend Update” <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NctoAyRDtzU" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">discussing</a> his favorite places to use the flamethrower.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">When he released a song about Harambe.</strong> It’s not easy to <a href="https://soundcloud.com/user-209448905?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">listen to</a>, but maybe Lonely Island could do something with it?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">When he had a Tesla designer named Franz throw a metal ball at a Cybertruck window...</strong>and it <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=udxR5rBq_Vg" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shattered</a>. It’s <em>SNL</em>’s duty to give us interviews with everyone involved in this incident. Someone in the audience, Franz, and of course the truck itself. All played by Melissa Villaseñor.</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Back by popular demand...Morning Brew Minis! As always, you can take your pick of difficulty:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/brew-mini-easy-difficulty?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Easy</a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/brew-mini-medium?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Medium </a></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/brew-mini-hard?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hard</a></span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Happy puzzling. And don't forget you can submit full-size crosswords as well. Read up on our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/13/morning-brew-crossword-submission-guidelines?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">submission guidelines here</a>.</p>

The Dow and S\u0026P hit \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/06/stock-futures-open-slightly-higher-ahead-of-key-april-jobs-report.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eall-time highs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, while everyone’s watching \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-07/elon-musk-on-snl-live-has-dogecoin-doge-traders-planning-parties?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edogecoin\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e ahead of Elon Musk’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eSNL \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eappearance tonight (yes, a real sentence). Roku stock shot up after reporting blistering revenue growth in Q1.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/07/april-jobs-report-big-whiff-us-economy?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBig Jobs Report Whiff\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Swing and a miss gif\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=399 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/l2R04CaebgtebcxvG/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Swing and a miss gif\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/l2R04CaebgtebcxvG/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday’s April jobs report was more disappointing than a Starburst pack filled only with yellow. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhereas economists had forecasted upwards of 1 million jobs added in April...the Labor Department said the US created \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-job-growth-far-below-expectations-april-amid-labor-shortages-2021-05-07/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejust 266,000\u003c/a\u003e. And the unemployment rate, which had been steadily dropping since last May, ticked up from 6% to 6.1%. Those numbers shocked pretty much everyone, given all the recent signs of a rapidly improving economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDigging \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/07/upshot/jobs-report-surprise.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einto the numbers\u003c/a\u003e...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTemporary-help employment lost 111,000 jobs, manufacturing 18,000, and retail 15,000. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTravel and leisure continued to fuel the gains after getting TKO’d early in the pandemic, adding 331,000 jobs in April. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe economy is still down more than 8 million jobs from pre-pandemic levels and \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/07/april-2021-jobs-report-1-in-4-unemployed-have-been-out-of-work-for-a-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e29% of unemployed Americans\u003c/a\u003e have now been out of work for at least a year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happened?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not so clear. What we do know is that there is no shortage of job openings in certain industries like retail, manufacturing, and construction. So the question economists are sorting out right now is why more people aren’t going to work. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere are a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-07/softer-u-s-april-job-growth-indicates-challenges-to-recovery?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efew hypotheses\u003c/a\u003e...\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid reasons: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDespite a blazing vaccination rollout in the US, many people might still fear getting infected with the virus at work. Plus, with some schools still opting for remote learning, parents might be taking care of their kids instead of job hunting.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSkills mismatch: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePerhaps the people looking for jobs don’t have the experience necessary to fill the types of jobs that are open.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEnhanced unemployment benefits: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis, of course, is the most controversial hypothesis. Biden’s aid package extended extra unemployment benefits through the summer, and Republicans and many business owners have blamed the extra money for disincentivizing work. After the jobs report was released, the US Chamber of Commerce asked lawmakers to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/us-chamber-calls-end-300-a-week-jobless-aid-ease-labor-shortage-2021-05-07/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eend the extra benefits\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eeconomists hope this jobs report was just a bizarre one-off, like Michael Jordan playing baseball. But President Biden said the labor market struggle bus is evidence that the US economy needs his twin infrastructure bills to return to full strength. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS The US is averaging 2.09 million doses a day, a \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/health/covid-vaccine-states-distribution-doses/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e21% decrease\u003c/a\u003e from the week before. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAround the world...\u003c/strong\u003eenough doses have been administered to fully vaccinate 8.1% of the global population, but wealthier countries are vaccinating their citizens at a rate \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e25x faster\u003c/a\u003e than lower income countries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe latest headlines\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGetting the green light: \u003c/strong\u003eThe WHO \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/who-china-sinopharm-vaccine-9d855f79-85be-40bb-8573-a23cf942b8d5.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eauthorized\u003c/a\u003e China’s Sinopharm vaccine for emergency use, the sixth vaccine to have gotten a stamp of approval from the organization. Pfizer-BioNTech became the first vaccine maker to apply for full FDA approval on top of emergency use. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVaccine incentives: \u003c/strong\u003eStates are pulling out their \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-07/new-jersey-governor-considering-cash-as-a-vaccine-incentive?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebag of tricks\u003c/a\u003e to spur more demand for vaccinations. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDebris from the Chinese rocket Long March-5B are expected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/china-rocket-space-falling/2021/05/07/e28412c4-af11-11eb-82c1-896aca955bb9_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efall back to Earth\u003c/a\u003e this weekend, just over a week after it was launched into space. The craft’s husk is almost 100 feet long, and will be one of the largest objects to ever come back into the planet’s atmosphere on an uncontrolled reentry.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis type of reentry is like ordering a swimsuit you saw on TikTok: There’s no way of knowing what you’re going to get. Scientists say there’s a 32-hour window over the weekend when it could hit, but aren’t sure where. There’s only a small chance of it hurting a person, but with some close calls like a \u003ca href=\"https://www.space.com/spacex-rocket-debris-found-washington-farm?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=Debris%20from%20SpaceX%20rocket%20launch%20falls%20on%20farm%20in%20central%20Washington,-By%20Hanneke%20Weitering\u0026text=A%20piece%20of%20debris%20from,stars%22%20the%20U.S.%20Pacific%20Northwest.\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehuge piece\u003c/a\u003e of SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket ending up on a Washington farm in April, experts are calling the actions of China’s space program irresponsible.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e With lax international laws around space debris, countries can do things like send rockets into space and cause a minor freak out. Jonathan McDowell of the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics told the WaPo, “What there isn’t at the moment is what I call a ‘reckless driving law.’ You only get to complain if it actually style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eElon Musk hosts \u003cem\u003eSNL\u003c/em\u003e tonight, and last weekend he took to Twitter to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1388611645560262660?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecrowdsource\u003c/a\u003e some sketch ideas for the show. And while “Irony Man” is...a fine suggestion, we think some of the best ways to showcase the Technoking’s subtle, grounded performance style would be to just rewrite some of the moments in Musk’s life that have felt like \u003cem\u003eSNL\u003c/em\u003e sketches:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhen he sold flamethrowers.\u003c/strong\u003e In a promotional stunt to sell more hats, Musk’s tunnel construction company, The Boring Company, introduced “Not-A-Flamethrower” (the product’s official name) and it sold out in five days. In the \u003cem\u003eSNL\u003c/em\u003e version, Bill Hader’s Stefon would be on “Weekend Update” \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NctoAyRDtzU\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ediscussing\u003c/a\u003e his favorite places to use the flamethrower.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhen he released a song about Harambe.\u003c/strong\u003e It’s not easy to \u003ca href=\"https://soundcloud.com/user-209448905?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elisten to\u003c/a\u003e, but maybe Lonely Island could do something with it?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhen he had a Tesla designer named Franz throw a metal ball at a Cybertruck window...\u003c/strong\u003eand it \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=udxR5rBq_Vg\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshattered\u003c/a\u003e. It’s \u003cem\u003eSNL\u003c/em\u003e’s duty to give us interviews with everyone involved in this incident. Someone in the audience, Franz, and of course the truck itself.
